alert.note: Alert for Appling; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 7:08PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wayne and northeastern Appling Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 708 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Odum, or 8 miles east of Surrency, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Surrency and Odum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
